## <span class="-mt-8 font-bold bg-gradient-to-r from-indigo-500 via-purple-500 to-pink-500 inline-block text-transparent bg-clip-text">Molecular Docking</span> {#blue_dash transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

Computational docking is widely used for study of protein-ligand interactions and for drug discovery and development.

::: fragment
<br> Tests the fit of a molecule in a protein binding site.
:::

::: fragment
<br> Sampling of large number of possible configurations. <br> Score for fit using one of several different scoring functions.
:::

## <span class="-mt-8 font-bold bg-gradient-to-r from-indigo-500 via-purple-500 to-pink-500 inline-block text-transparent bg-clip-text">Docking – types</span>{#dock_types transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

::: incremental
-    Bound-Bound Docking

    -   [Docking where both the docked molecules are from a bound conformation.]{.text-3xl}

-    Bound-Unbound Docking

    -   [Docking where one of the molecules is from a bound confomation.]{.text-3xl}

-    Unbound-Unbound Docking

    -   [Docking where both the docked molecules are from an unbound conformation.]{.text-3xl}
:::

## <span class="-mt-8 font-bold bg-gradient-to-r from-indigo-500 via-purple-500 to-pink-500 inline-block text-transparent bg-clip-text">Input -- target receptor</span>{#inp_target transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

::: fragment
Missing loops and sidechains, mutations.
:::

::: fragment
Low occupancy, high displacement parameters.
:::

::: fragment
Water molecules – enclosed in the targeted binding pocket, interacting with the co-crystalized ligand.
:::

::: fragment
Cofactors - should be considered if they are involved in ligand recognition e.g. heme.
:::

::: fragment
Hydrogen atoms – added as a part of receptor preparation in all docking programs.
:::

::: fragment
In case no experimentally determined structure is available then homology derived structural model can be used.
:::

::: {.justify-end .text-base .text-right}
Bender et al, Nat Protoc 16, 4799–4832 (2021)
:::

## <span class="-mt-8 font-bold bg-gradient-to-r from-indigo-500 via-purple-500 to-pink-500 inline-block text-transparent bg-clip-text">Input -- Binding site</span> {#inp_bs transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

A high-resolution ligand-bound structure.

<p class="text-3xl pl-8">
holo conformation performs better than apo.
</p>

<p class="text-3xl pl-8">
geometries of the binding pocket are better defined.
</p>

::: fragment
In the absence of defined binding pocket, prediction methods can be used to find potential binding sites.
:::

::: fragment
Generally small buried binding sites better than large exposed ones.
:::

::: {.justify-end .text-base .text-right}
Bender et al, Nat Protoc 16, 4799–4832 (2021)
:::

## <span class="-mt-8 font-bold bg-gradient-to-r from-indigo-500 via-purple-500 to-pink-500 inline-block text-transparent bg-clip-text">Docking -- control</span> {#dock_control transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

Using a known inhibitor(s) to optimize binding pocket and docking parameters.

<p class="text-3xl pl-8">
Docking should be able to reproduce the binding mode of the known inhibitor.
</p>

::: fragment
Known actives should rank higher against a background of decoy molecules.
:::

::: fragment
Negative control – known inactives; should rank low in docking.
:::

::: fragment
Without known ligands as positive controls, one is at a substantial disadvantage at setting up docking calculations.
:::

::: {.justify-end .text-base .text-right}
Bender et al, Nat Protoc 16, 4799–4832 (2021)
:::

## <span class="-mt-8 font-bold bg-gradient-to-r from-indigo-500 via-purple-500 to-pink-500 inline-block text-transparent bg-clip-text">Docking -- Hit selection</span> {#dock_hit transition="concave" transition-speed="slow"}

Compounds may be filtered for both positive and negative features.

<p class="text-3xl pl-8">
Docked orientation has favorable interactions with key residues.
</p>

<p class="text-3xl pl-16 text-gray-500">
binding affinity, ligand efficiency, solubility, toxicity, etc.
</p>

::: fragment
Closely related compounds will likely dock in similar poses with similar score, cluster compounds by 2D structure similarity after all other filters have been used and only select the best scoring cluster representative for testing.
:::

::: {.justify-end .text-base .text-right}
Bender et al, Nat Protoc 16, 4799–4832 (2021)
:::
